00061 /*
00062  * svc_raw.c,   This a toy for simple testing and timing.
00063  * Interface to create an rpc client and server in the same UNIX process.
00064  * This lets us simulate rpc and get rpc (round trip) overhead, without
00065  * any interference from the kernel.
00066  *
00067  * Copyright (C) 1984, Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00068  */
00069 
00070 #include "Rpc.h"
00071 
00072 
00073 /*
00074  * This is the "network" that we will be moving data over
00075  */
00076 static struct Svcraw_private {
00077         char    _raw_buf[UDPMSGSIZE];
00078         SVCXPRT server;
00079         XDR     xdr_stream;
00080         char    verf_body[MAX_AUTH_BYTES];
00081 } *Svcraw_private;
00082 
00083 static bool_t           Svcraw_recv();
00084 static enum xprt_stat   Svcraw_stat();
00085 static bool_t           Svcraw_getargs();
00086 static bool_t           Svcraw_reply();
00087 static bool_t           Svcraw_freeargs();
00088 static void             Svcraw_destroy();
00089 
00090 static struct xp_ops server_ops = {
00091         Svcraw_recv,
00092         Svcraw_stat,
00093         Svcraw_getargs,
00094         Svcraw_reply,
00095         Svcraw_freeargs,
00096         Svcraw_destroy
00097 };
00098 
00099 SVCXPRT *
00100 Svcraw_create()
00101 {
00102         register struct Svcraw_private *srp = Svcraw_private;
00103 
00104         if (srp == 0) {
00105                 srp = (struct Svcraw_private *)mem_calloc(1, sizeof (*srp));
00106                 if (srp == 0)
00107                         return (0);
00108         }
00109         srp->server.xp_sock = 0;
00110         srp->server.xp_port = 0;
00111         srp->server.xp_ops = &server_ops;
00112         srp->server.xp_verf.oa_base = srp->verf_body;
00113         Xdrmem_create(&srp->xdr_stream, srp->_raw_buf, UDPMSGSIZE, XDR_FREE);
00114         return (&srp->server);
00115 }
00116 
00117 static enum xprt_stat
00118 Svcraw_stat()
00119 {
00120 
00121         return (XPRT_IDLE);
00122 }
00123 
00124 static bool_t
00125 Svcraw_recv(xprt, msg)
00126         SVCXPRT *xprt;
00127         struct Rpc_msg *msg;
00128 {
00129         register struct Svcraw_private *srp = Svcraw_private;
00130         register XDR *xdrs;
00131 
00132         if (srp == 0)
00133                 return (0);
00134         xdrs = &srp->xdr_stream;
00135         xdrs->x_op = XDR_DECODE;
00136         XDR_SETPOS(xdrs, 0);
00137         if (! Xdr_callmsg(xdrs, msg))
00138                return (FALSE);
00139         return (TRUE);
00140 }
00141 
00142 static bool_t
00143 Svcraw_reply(xprt, msg)
00144         SVCXPRT *xprt;
00145         struct Rpc_msg *msg;
00146 {
00147         register struct Svcraw_private *srp = Svcraw_private;
00148         register XDR *xdrs;
00149 
00150         if (srp == 0)
00151                 return (FALSE);
00152         xdrs = &srp->xdr_stream;
00153         xdrs->x_op = XDR_ENCODE;
00154         XDR_SETPOS(xdrs, 0);
00155         if (! Xdr_replymsg(xdrs, msg))
00156                return (FALSE);
00157         (void)XDR_GETPOS(xdrs);  /* called just for overhead */
00158         return (TRUE);
00159 }
00160 
00161 static bool_t
00162 Svcraw_getargs(xprt, xdr_args, args_ptr)
00163         SVCXPRT *xprt;
00164         Xdrproc_t xdr_args;
00165         caddr_t args_ptr;
00166 {
00167         register struct Svcraw_private *srp = Svcraw_private;
00168 
00169         if (srp == 0)
00170                 return (FALSE);
00171         return ((*xdr_args)(&srp->xdr_stream, args_ptr));
00172 }
00173 
00174 static bool_t
00175 Svcraw_freeargs(xprt, xdr_args, args_ptr)
00176         SVCXPRT *xprt;
00177         Xdrproc_t xdr_args;
00178         caddr_t args_ptr;
00179 {
00180         register struct Svcraw_private *srp = Svcraw_private;
00181         register XDR *xdrs;
00182 
00183         if (srp == 0)
00184                 return (FALSE);
00185         xdrs = &srp->xdr_stream;
00186         xdrs->x_op = XDR_FREE;
00187         return ((*xdr_args)(xdrs, args_ptr));
00188 }
00189 
00190 static void
00191 Svcraw_destroy()
00192 {
00193 }
